{"id":1448593608,"question_id":3380,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 week, 6 days","timestamp":1731236661,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1448593608/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Shortest Subarray With OR at Least K II","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minimumSubarrayLength(vector<int>& nums, int k) {\n\n        int n = nums.size();\n        int min_len = n;\n        \n        int start = 0;\n        int end = 0;\n        int or_val = nums[end];\n\n        while(start<=end && end<n){\n            \n            or_val |= nums[end];\n\n            if(or_val >= k){\n                int len = end - start + 1;\n                min_len = (min_len < len)?min_len:len;\n\n                // how to remove start element from the OR value so that start++ ?\n                // use a bitmask\n\n                int bitmask = or_val;\n                for(int i=start+1; i<end;i++){\n                    bitmask &= (~nums[i]);\n                }\n\n                // this bitmask value will be the first element.\n                cout<<bitmask<<endl;\n\n                // to remove this from the OR val\n                or_val &= (~bitmask);\n                start++;\n            }\n            else{\n                end++;\n            }\n        }\n\n        return min_len;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"shortest-subarray-with-or-at-least-k-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
